info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 12:41PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Colorado... Colorado River near CO-UT State Line affecting Mesa and Grand Counties. .The combination of warm, spring temperatures, potential for periods of rain on snowpack, and controlled reservoir releases upstream will all contribute to increased runoff. High water levels and strong flow in the Colorado River is expected through the weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain, snowmelt, and reservoir releases continues. * WHERE...Colorado River near CO-UT State Line. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...at 10.0 ft, minor flooding is expected between Redlands and Loma, and sections of the Riverfront Pedestrian/Bike Trail become inundated with water. Impacts...at 12.00 ft, low-land flooding is likely between the Redlands and Loma, multiple sections of the bike path along the Colorado River may be inundated and become impassable. Water levels approach bridge structures along I-70, between Fruita and Loma. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM MDT Friday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above bankfull, but below flood stage, with a 10-Day forecast maximum value of 13.4 feet or 37,900 cfs by next Friday. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks, and please heed all trail and roadway closures. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
